channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The world is getting tougher on kids’ online safety in 2026

item.title: Trump claims all the U.S. automakers are ‘doing great.’ Gretchen Whitmer says ‘this will only get worse without a serious shift’
item.description: “America stands more alone than she has in decades,” the Michigan governor said at the Detroit Auto Show.

item.title: The AI Trade Looks More Reliable After U.S.-Taiwan Deal
item.description: The new trade agreement reduces tariff uncertainty around semiconductors.

item.title: Steve Jobs Wasn’t Always ‘Steve Jobs’
item.description: And with time and effort, nor will you be the person you are today.

item.title: Roblox launched age-verification rules. Days later, age-verified accounts were available on eBay

item.title: Ben Affleck Says His Company’s Bonus Plan Doesn’t Guarantee Money—but Team Members Still Love Working There
item.description: Crew members on Artists Equity movies have praised the way the company values them.

item.title: The 1 Fundamental Shift Required for Great Leadership in 2026 and Beyond
item.description: We must believe in the possibility that putting people ahead of profits actually leads to more profit.

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley says the White House will ‘always answer the phone,’ but needs Trump to do more to curtail China’s threat to America’s autos
item.description: President Donald Trump paid a visit to Ford’s Michigan factory this week to spotlight U.S. manufacturing.

item.title: Protect your agentic AI before you wreck your agentic AI
item.description: On the nuances of agentic AI-driven change management during the 2026 Fortune Brainstorm Tech dinner during CES in Las Vegas.

item.title: How the ‘One Block Rule’ Keeps You Sane and Healthy in a Cold, Dark Winter
item.description: To avoid the winter blues, psychologists say you need to get outside. This rule can help you actually do it.
